nodes.text: At the end of a quiet side street, you eventually find the right building.
A three-story relic from the ’40s, with a rust-eaten plaque on its wall that reads: Azalea 28.
From that distance, the plaque looks small and half-hidden by ivy leaves.
“Ah…” Your sister catches up to you and stops in front of the building. She looks up at the third-floor windows, a hint of a smile on her face. “Morningstar’s palace.”
“That plaque is unreadable, but it does look like the place she described…”
“Hmm.” Your sister catches up to you. She almost sticks her face between the bars of the building’s fence, trying to read the rusty plaque. “Tch… that magazine is making me blind.”
“But yeah… I think this is the place. Looks like it.”
“That plaque is unreadable, but it does look like the place she described…”
“I can’t believe we haven’t been here before.”
